title: Identify Continuous Variables
text: Recognize that continuous variables can take any value within a range.

title: Characteristics of a Scatterplot
text: Each point on a scatterplot represents a pair of values for the two variables.

title: Comparing Graph Types
text: A bar chart is used for categorical data, not continuous variables.

title: Line Graph Usage
text: A line graph is typically used to show trends and how one variable changes over time, not relationships between two variables.

title: Pie Chart Usage
text: A pie chart is used to show proportions of a whole, not relationships between variables.
